name: Apple Apple scab
info: Apple scab is a fungal disease that causes dark, sunken lesions on leaves, fruit, and stems.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and fruits.
Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Ensure proper air circulation to prevent fungal growth.

name: Apple Black rot
info: Black rot is caused by a fungal pathogen and leads to dark lesions on fruits and stems.
solutions: Prune infected branches and dispose of them.
Apply fungicides with a copper base.
Ensure proper spacing and air circulation for the plants.

name: Apple Cedar apple rust
info: Cedar apple rust is a fungal disease that causes yellow-orange lesions on leaves and fruit.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and fruits.
Spray fungicides containing captan or sulfur.
Control cedar trees near apple orchards as they are alternate hosts.

name: Apple healthy
info: Your apple plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Keep up regular watering and care!

name: Blueberry healthy
info: Your blueberry plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Ensure proper watering, especially during dry periods.

name: Cherry healthy
info: Your cherry plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Maintain proper irrigation and care.

name: Cherry Powdery mildew
info: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that causes white, powdery growth on leaves, stems, and buds.
solutions: Remove infected parts of the plant.
Apply fungicides containing sulfur or neem oil.
Ensure good airflow around the plant to reduce humidity.

name: Corn Cercospora leaf spot
info: Cercospora leaf spot is a fungal disease that causes grayish lesions on corn leaves.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.
Avoid overhead irrigation to reduce leaf wetness.

name: Corn Common rust
info: Common rust is a fungal disease that causes reddish pustules on corn leaves.
solutions: Remove infected plants and leaves.
Apply fungicides to prevent further spread.

name: Corn healthy
info: Your corn plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Ensure proper soil and water conditions.

name: Corn Northern Leaf Blight
info: Northern leaf blight causes long, grayish lesions on corn leaves.
solutions: Remove infected leaves.
Apply fungicides such as tebuconazole or azoxystrobin.

name: Grape Black rot
info: Black rot is caused by a fungal pathogen and leads to black lesions on grape berries and leaves.
solutions: Remove infected parts of the plant.
Apply fungicides with copper or sulfur.

name: Grape Esca(Black Measles)
info: Esca is a grapevine disease that causes rapid wilting and a decrease in berry quality.
solutions: Remove infected vines and treat with fungicides.
Prune away infected wood to limit disease spread.

name: Grape healthy
info: Your grape plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Keep your plant hydrated and prune regularly.

name: Grape Leaf blight
info: Leaf blight causes yellowing and browning of grape leaves, leading to poor fruit quality.
solutions: Remove and discard infected leaves.
Apply fungicides with sulfur or copper.

name: Orange Haunglongbing
info: Haunglongbing (HLB), also known as citrus greening, is a bacterial disease that causes yellowing of leaves and fruit drop.
solutions: Remove infected trees.
Use antibiotics to manage bacterial spread.

name: Peach Bacterial spot
info: Bacterial spot causes dark, sunken lesions on peach leaves, twigs, and fruit.
solutions: Prune infected branches and dispose of them.
Use copper-based bactericides to prevent infection.

name: Peach healthy
info: Your peach plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Regular watering and pruning will help maintain its health.

name: Pepper bell Bacterial spot
info: Bacterial spot causes lesions on pepper leaves, stems, and fruit.
solutions: Remove and dispose of infected plant parts.
Apply copper-based bactericides.

name: Pepper bell healthy
info: Your pepper plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Regular irrigation and care are essential.

name: Potato Early blight
info: Early blight causes dark, concentric rings on potato leaves, often leading to leaf death.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.
Ensure proper plant spacing and air circulation.

name: Potato healthy
info: Your potato plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Maintain proper watering and soil health.

name: Potato Late blight
info: Late blight is a fungal disease that causes dark lesions on potato leaves and tubers.
solutions: Remove infected parts immediately.
Apply fungicides like metalaxyl or chlorothalonil.

name: Raspberry healthy
info: Your raspberry plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Keep your plant hydrated and properly pruned.

name: Soybean healthy
info: Your soybean plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Monitor for pest damage and ensure good soil conditions.

name: Squash Powdery mildew
info: Powdery mildew causes a white, powdery fungal growth on squash leaves.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.
Increase plant spacing to reduce humidity.

name: Strawberry healthy
info: Your strawberry plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Regular watering and care will help maintain plant health.

name: Strawberry Leaf scorch
info: Leaf scorch causes browning and drying at the edges of strawberry leaves.
solutions: Water regularly and avoid over-fertilizing.
Remove affected leaves to reduce spread.

name: Tomato Bacterial spot
info: Bacterial spot causes dark, sunken lesions on tomato leaves and fruits.
solutions: Remove infected parts and dispose of them.
Use copper-based bactericides.

name: Tomato Early blight
info: Early blight causes dark, circular spots on tomato leaves and stems.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and stems.
Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil.

name: Tomato healthy
info: Your tomato plant is healthy. No disease detected.
solutions: Ensure proper watering and support for healthy growth.

name: Tomato Late blight
info: Late blight causes dark lesions on tomato leaves, stems, and fruit.
solutions: Remove and discard infected parts.
Apply fungicides such as mefenoxam.

name: Tomato Leaf Mold
info: Leaf mold is a fungal disease causing yellowing and mold on tomato leaves.
solutions: Prune infected leaves and ensure proper air circulation.

name: Tomato Septoria leaf spot
info: Septoria leaf spot causes small, dark lesions on tomato leaves.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.
Ensure proper irrigation practices.

name: Tomato Spider mites Two-spotted spider mite
info: Spider mites cause speckled, discolored leaves on tomato plants.
solutions: Apply miticides and remove infected leaves.

name: Tomato Target Spot
info: Target Spot causes circular, necrotic lesions on tomato leaves.
solutions: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.

name: Tomato Tomato mosaic virus
info: Tomato mosaic virus causes mottling and distortion of tomato leaves.
solutions: Remove and destroy infected plants.
Use virus-free seeds for planting.

name: Tomato Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
info: Yellow Leaf Curl Virus causes yellowing and curling of tomato leaves.
solutions: Remove infected plants.
Use resistant varieties of tomatoes.
